profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:15-0400

did.unittitle: Daniel Horsmanden selected papers, 1714-1747, relating to the Six Nations
did.abstract: These papers include 140 pages of letters, council minutes of Indian conferences, petitions, and speeches, concerning the activities of the New York Assembly and the Six Nations, principally for 1745-1747. Also contains a 200-page addendum of papers of the Van Shack family, pertaining to the same subjects. Table of contents included.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by William N. Fenton, grantee, 1953.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: These materials are not to be used for publication, or reproduction, in whole or in part, without the written consent of the New York Historical Society.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: There is an introduction and index to these papers written by Henry C. Van Schaack (1845) on the microfilm reel.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Daniel Horsmanden was chief justice of New York; he was elected to the American Philosophical Society in 1744.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in New York Historical Society.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.
